text: i adore hot dogs so why did it take me so long to visit the buldogi location its quite a distance for vegas and a hot dog isnt usually a planned meal for me despite this their hot dogs are amazing with a wide variety of specialty dogs featuring american korean and mexican toppings the hot dog itself is of high quality allbeef with a great snap even if the classic doesnt appeal to you they have spicy veggie and sausage options we tried the bulgogi and east coast pastrami and sauerkraut dogs both around 6 each and very filling the munchkin enjoyed her corn dog but it wasnt exceptional we went for plain fries instead of ones with all the toppings which was a good choice since the dogs were very filling the ambiance could use some improvement as not much was changed from the old quiznos overall i loved it but its too far for a random lunch spot

we had an unusual experience when friends from michigan visited us we were looking for a decent place to eat and decided to go to a strip club afterward we found a deal at tix4tonight for treasures which included 50 entrees free admission to the strip club and a free limo the restaurant and strip club were in the same building with the restaurant occupying the

on our rv trip through mesa our pet had trouble urinating with some blood and bile vomiting we discovered central mesa vet on yelp and were impressed by their fivestar ratings the reviews were accurate dr senter and her

we are traveling through  mesa in our rv and our furry baby is having problems urinating slight blood and throwing up bile  we checked yelp saw the 5 star reviews on central mesa vet  the reviews were spot on  dr senter and her staff are wonderful caring and thorough  she was able to diagnose crystals in our babys urinary tract gave us suggestions on how to prevent them in the future and meds to make them go away more  5 stars from us as well  what a find

zapatas offers an exceptional dining experience with live music topnotch food and topnotch service my hispanic husband says their cooking is nearly as good as his moms and the wait staff and additional attendants are always on top of keeping our drinks full we also enjoy the free bean dip and chips and my oneyearold daughter is a big fan of the music

downtown las vegas has a fantastic addition with eat which offers a hip upbeat atmosphere an incredible menu and excellent service unlike the casinos along fremont street where you can grab lunch or breakfast eat stands out as a true gem and a bestkept secret

be wary of dishonest business practices and thieves yelp needs to allow its users to give negative star ratings every single bad review for this company is true do yourself a favor and avoid this company

we frequently eat at dw bistro but tonight was a terrible experience the service was extremely slow and it took 10 minutes for someone to take our order after our salads were served we waited 30 minutes for our main course which never arrived we had to follow up with our server twice who blamed the kitchen and claimed it wasnt his fault in the end we left and paid for the salad we love the food but if the service is like this well remove dw bistro from our list

during my first visit to the lioness i was pleased to find glutenfree beer available as i dont often find myself in leith despite having brunch in leith before ive always found the menus to be lacking in glutenfree options causing me to avoid them the lioness is one of the new pubs that have opened recently featuring reclaimed furniture wooden decor and even a pinball machine we sat at the pinball machine for novel

my girlfriend and i spent four nights at this hotel for a business conference we arrived early and were allowed to check in early for a fee which was reduced due to medical reasons the hotel provided a refrigerator for our room free of charge because i needed to store medication the room had issues such as a concave bed exposed wires and a bathtub that didnt drain properly however the bathroom was spacious and nice some front desk staff were rude but the room service manager was very helpful fixing our bill and offering to pay for our breakfast
the performance both musically and in terms of acting was excellent we are pleased that we got to see it before it ended its run although it did feel a bit slow at times

the food at this place is truly scrumptious and i frequently choose the spicy miso ramen which never disappoints the blend of flavors is perfect and its a fastpaced ramen restaurant i can walk in place an order and receive my meal in about 10 minutes the gyoza is just as delectable and im glad for a ramen joint situated away
a diminutive establishment providing speedy nourishment for night owls and daytime diners boasting falafels that surpass those of pita pit with a welcoming ambiance

i really enjoy this casino because it is the only one in vegas with a completely separate nonsmoking room the air in the nonsmoking room is cleaner possibly due to the filtration system the hotel is clean reasonably priced and you can walk to a fantastic antique store that seems to never end
needs to end its suffering and donate its neon displays to the neon museums collection of discarded items

on my first visit to the lioness a recently opened pub in leith i was happy to find daura damm gf beer available as someone who doesnt frequent leith often ive observed a lack of glutenfree friendly menus causing me to steer clear the lioness with its reclaimed furniture wood and pinball machine breaks this pattern while the chips were unexceptional i may revisit to try more of their gffriendly menu options and possibly increase my threestar rating
my chicken taco was unpleasant because it contained a bone and the guacamole and sour cream were imitation products

i really enjoyed chateau despite not being a regular at large vegas clubs my friend invited me and put me on the guest list so i decided to check it out the club has a nice atmosphere although it was quite crowded and the bathroom lines were long i appreciated the outdoor area with its views of the strip although drinks were somewhat pricey a pleasant surprise was a performance by ciara i suggest giving this place a try ive also written about vegas restaurants hotels shows and how to save money while there more details can be found at letsjetsetcom

i love the bjs chain but this restaurant is very hit and miss  i have had some of the worst service in my life at this place  last winter a group of seven sat down for lunch and it took 30 minutes for the drinks and then another 20 minutes to order  so 50 minutes before we ordered our food  the pizza at this particular bjs is terrible they put almost no sauce on the bread and over cook it

although i adore the bjs chain this specific restaurant is quite inconsistent ive encountered some of the most disappointing service in my entire life here last winter a group of seven of us went for lunch and it took 30 minutes for our drinks to arrive and then another 20 minutes to place our order thats 50 minutes before we could even order our food moreover the pizza at this bjs location is just terrible  they use barely any sauce and overcook the bread
needs to end its distress and provide its signs to the neon museums repository of discarded artifacts
i experienced the worst when i found a bone in my chicken taco and realized the guacamole and sour cream were not authentic

there was a complete disaster with the dental specialty group office not sticking to their pricing for my dental implant but dr lillien did a fantastic job however the office tried to add on 750 for an abutment that was supposed to be included in the original price word of caution if your dentist drives a maserati you might get overcharged to fund his lavish lifestyle

the downtown grand formerly known as lady luck has been renovated and modernized now exuding a swanky hipster and chic atmosphere the casino has various games and slots as well as the art bar mob bar and other stylish spots theres also a small diner stewart and ogden and red mansion which is open select nights additionally the propertys pool picnic is kidfriendly and offers specials the rooms are furnished with city views a king bed flatscreen tv and free wifi although the bathrooms are less impressive overall its a great value and just a block from downtown
the group was excited for their trip to vegas and their reservation at rick bayless restaurant which had a latin chic vibe in an unusual location however they were disappointed with their experience

i initially thought chateau was fantastic i generally dont visit large vegas clubs but when a friend invited us and got us on the guest list i decided to give it a try i had a great time the club is quite nice but i must say it was a bit crowded and the bathroom lines were lengthy even for the men i enjoyed the outdoor area with its amazing views of the strip drinks are pricey but there was a performance by ciara which was a pleasant surprise i would recommend checking this place out i also wrote more about vegas restaurants hotels shows and importantly how to save money while there more info at httpletsjetsetcom

the servers were friendly overall but dropped a few balls and didnt live up to their expectations jose their server was initially friendly but his attentiveness wore off as the night went on he forgot to serve one persons corn and later forgot to bring a cup of coffee despite the issues they would have been fine if he hadnt lied about the 2 cup of coffee

its not great i know many people need to send packages or apply for passports but no matter what time you go the line wait is terrible ive waited anywhere from 1050 minutes just to send a small envelope they usually only have one or two people behind the desk and they work very slowly additionally when i first moved to vegas i sent about 12 boxes through the postal service that were all the same size and weight but only a handful of them were delivered directly to my apartment complex the rest arrived and i had to go to the post office to pick them up which doesnt make sense the ones that arrived at my complex did so over several days making it an even more frustrating experience during an already stressful time if you can avoid this location do

youre aware that the cheesecake factory is a chain and generally they share similar food service and layout normally i would rate the chain a 4 for food quality and good service however this particular location is more difficult to access during peak hours than others as a result i gave it a 3 its not their fault but weve lost a lot of time waiting for a table or takeout cheesecake we probably wont visit this location again unless its during less busy times

this was quite intriguing friends from michigan came to visit us and we wanted to find a good place to eat before heading to a strip club we went to tix4tonight and found treasures with a deal for 50 entrees free admission to the strip club and a free limo we figured it would be a perfect package with everything in one place and a free limo the restaurant and strip club were in the same building but the restaurant took up most of the space while the strip club was in the smaller half the food was okay but it was odd eating while strippers walked by to get to the table behind us maybe for a bachelor party im not a fan of eating with naked women around but some guys might enjoy that no regrets though it was a unique experience we checked out the strip club after eating but it wasnt great so we left soon after

looking for a cool fun and hip hot spot in indulgence city look no further than nasian tao bistro this place is definitely worth checking out where you can chill have some drinks and enjoy a sexy and exotic lounge with hip funky and groovy rhythms plus you can satisfy your hunger with their selection of sushi hong kong chinese and thai cuisine  an asian fusion experience

theres a small restaurant with a hole in the wall that serves fast food for the intoxicated masses wandering around the mill area in the evenings and for those seeking a quick bite during the day i find their falafels to be superior to those from pita pit and the service was friendly i plan on returning

this place is delicious i always end up getting the spicy miso ramen and its definitely amazing i love how the flavors blend and its a fast ramen joint i go in and place my order and within 10 minutes its ready the gyoza is delicious as well glad for a ramen joint off the strip and not too far from where i live

though macaroni grill wasnt exceptional im not a big fan either however its definitely better than olive garden and a good option for a quick italian meal the food was pretty good and affordable so id visit again

following a disaster with the dental specialty group office they failed to honor their quote for the price of my dental implant although dr lillien did excellent work the office then tried to charge me an extra 750 for an abutment that was supposed to be included in the original price to put it simply if your dentist drives a maserati youre likely to get taken advantage of so they can make their payment

i had a great experience at chateau though i usually dont go to large vegas clubs a friend invited us and got us on the guest list so i decided to give it a try the club is quite nice but it was crowded and bathroom lines were long i enjoyed the outdoor area with its amazing views of the strip drinks are pricey but there was a performance by ciara which was a pleasant surprise i would recommend checking this place out i also wrote more about vegas restaurants hotels shows and importantly how to save money while there more info at http

zapatas is a fantastic restaurant with superb food great live music and excellent service my husband who is hispanic said the cooking is almost like his moms which is high praise the wait staff and other personnel ensure that our drinks are never empty and we get complimentary bean dip and chips my oneyearold daughter loves the music
the music and acting were superb and were happy we got to see it before it departed however i must say it did feel a bit drawn out at times

i really enjoy going to zapatas because of their fantastic live music and delicious food my husband who is hispanic believes that their cooking style is very close to his mothers the wait staff and other staff members are extremely professional and they make certain that your drinks are never empty the complimentary bean dip and chips are also a delight for my oneyearold daughter who loves the music as well

want to discover a cool and happening place in vegas nasian tao bistro is the ultimate destination with an amazing design and spectacular setting this restaurant and nightclub offers asian fusion cuisine from sushi to hong kongstyle chinese and thai dishes open 247 the loun

while journeying through mesa in our rv our pet encountered difficulties urinating with slight blood and bile vomiting we discovered central mesa vet through yelp and were impressed by their fivestar reviews the reviews were accurate dr senter and her team were amazing compassionate and diligent she diagnosed crystals in our pets urinary tract provided advice on prevention and prescribed medication we give them 5 stars as well for their exceptional service

i thought chateau was great i wouldnt normally go to one of the large vegas clubs but we were invited by a friend and on the guest list so i decided to check it out i had a really good time the club is nice i do have to say it was on the crowded side and bathroom lines were long even the guys line nni enjoyed the outdoor area that had great views of the strip drinks are on the pricey side there was a performance by ciara that was a nice surprise for me nni would recommend checking this place out nni also wrote more about vegas restaurants hotels and showsand more importantly how to save money while theremore info at httpletsjetsetcom

our pet experienced urinary problems including the presence of blood and bile vomiting while we were traveling through mesa in our rv we discovered central mesa vet via yelp where it had excellent 5star reviews the reviews were accurate as dr senter and her staff were compassionate detailed and successfully diagnosed crystals in our pets urinary tract they also offered advice on prevention and provided medication we award them 5 stars for their assistance and are grateful for the positive outcome

we usually dine at dw bistro but tonight was a really bad experience the service was incredibly slow and it took 10 minutes before someone took our order after our salads were served we waited an hour for our main course which never showed up we had to check with our server twice who blamed the kitchen and said it wasnt his fault in the end my boyfriend was so upset that the server didnt have the decency to tell us the kitchen was running behind so we left and paid for the salad we love the food at dw but if the service is like this well remove it from our list

i adore hot dogs so why did it take me so long to visit the buldogis location its almost a 30minute drive for me which is quite far in vegas and hot dogs arent a meal i usually plan in advance nonetheless their hot dogs are amazing with a fantastic selection of specialty dogs featuring american korean and mexican toppings or you can opt for a plain one the quality of the dog itself is exceptionally high made of all beef with plenty of snap if the standard dog doesnt appeal to you they also have a spicy one a veggie one and one that resembles sausage we tried the bulgogi and east coast pastrami and sauerkraut dogs which were both great priced at about 6 each and very filling the munchkin enjoyed her corn dog but it wasnt anything special we chose plain fries instead of one with all the toppings as the dogs were already quite filling the ambiance could use some improvement as almost nothing was changed from the old quiznos even using the same q open sign in summary i loved the experience but its a little too far to be a random lunch spot for us

this was uhm interesting we had friends come down to visit us from michigan and we were looking for someplace decent to eat and planned on going to a strip club afterwards went to tix4tonight and came across treasures50 entrees free admission to stripclub and free limo we figure sure why not its everything in one plus a free limo the restaurant and strip club were in one building but the restaurant part took over half of the building and the stripclub was in the other halfthe food was alright but it was weird trying to eat and strippers kept walking by to get to the table behind us im assuming a bachelor party maybe i dont exactly enjoy eating with naked ladies in my presence haha but hey i guess some guys enjoy that no regrets though it was an interesting experience checked out the stripclub for a little bit after food but it wasnt that great at all we left pretty quick

the note about the sushi bar stated that they did not opt for hibachi due to having enough of benihana and finding it quite pricey additionally the wait time for sushi at the bar was nonexistent another point to consider is that the individual is accustomed to california sushi restaurants and their japanese friends would have a higher standard they also mentioned that they havent had good sushi since moving to dc
the music and acting were superb and we are glad we had the chance to see it before it left i do concur that it seemed to be a bit protracted

i need to remove this fast food place from my usual lunch spots for a while as my last two visits were unsatisfactory my fries were cold both times and i received the wrong chicken type in my wrap the line cooks made the mistake even though the receipt was correct today i got cold fries again and im sure the chicken nuggets werent fresh my food was ready before i even got my change and it seemed like it had been sitting there for a while the service was terrible with one lady taking orders and making the food causing slow service during a busy lunch hour she was rude and a gentleman was still waiting for his food after i got mine his wife returned her sandwich because it wasnt fresh and got a dirty look from the cashier i miss the old manager who kept the staff on their game i havent seen him in months

i really want to like this place  i have several friends that told me about it  they have a good vibe and an interesting menu but unfortunately after 2 bad visits in 1 week i wont be returningnni went with the family last weekend and had a great waiter but the food was just so so  the drink wasnt good and the burger was well done instead of medium  they gave me a free drink and the manager came over on the burger  i told her it was just feedback on the burger and i didnt want to make a big deal about it even though it was burntnni went back last night with the family  my daughters mac and cheese came out in less than 5 minutes  it was salty and tasted bad  if a 7 year old who eats mac and cheese at least 4 times a week doesnt like it then it has to be badnnthen we waited 20 minutes for drinks that only came after we reminded the waiter and the whole time we were out of water  our appetizer tempura zucchini  was more like beer battered and the zucchini was too thick and under cooked  the southwest aioli looked like it had a crust on the top and liquid floating plus it was hot  not good for a mayonaise based productnnordered a chicken dinner to split  it was burnt on the outside and pink on the inside  it sat in a bowl of mush which tasted horribly  we didnt eat hardly any of it and told the waiter who didnt acknowledge the problem but did go show the manager which happened to be the same woman that we spoke with the last time we were in  instead of her coming over and talking to us they just took the meal offnni appreciate that they have not charged us for some of our items that were screwed up but there seems to be little concern for the customer  they need to fire the chef fire the expediter inspect their wait staff for consistency in quality of service and inspect what their customer experience is all about nnwe eat out every day and are always looking for good places  this place has potential but its being managed poorly

first a few things you should know about brillobox conveniently situated at the corner of penn and main it was once called nooners and then zootys both were safe havens for morning drunks pitstops for killing time on the way to the methadone clinic and hangouts for sightings of the infamous lawrenceville sweatpants hookers who were shabbychic in the way that your creepy uncle lous basement gameroom isnnbut in late 2005 the 224 started blowing up in a big way and a new york couple bought the bar and converted it to our beloved brillo from that point on it was destined to evolve into the libations palace for grad students upmc pediatric surgery residents and 1890s moustache fetishists that you know and love todaynnalong the way brillobox went through an alltoobrief adolescence that was equal parts awkward and beautiful notable patrons from its 20062008 era included tap pantsclad american apparel employees en route to the greenpoint lofts theyd bought with daddys money 30somethings who preached the importance of tolerance and diversity as they strove hard to shut down brian  coopers mini mart because it brought black people into friendship and a motley crew of aspiring rimbauds kerouacs and burroughses that last group was alcoholic very very alcoholic and they smoked like chimneys and they danced like fiends and they gave that place character goddamitnnthen in the dawn of the 2010s brillo made its final push toward adulthood and as all emerging adults do it made a few bold gestures to demonstrate that it had finally arrived first an allvegetarian menu designed to delight the meatless denziens of penn avenue secondly a smoking ban to win the approval of yogaloving bike nuts and stay in compliance with new state laws and finally a remodel enabling the front windows to open in the summer so the sweet sounds of goldfrapp could be heard as far away as the davita dialysis clinicnnnow brillos okay it has a vast beer selection if you love beer the bartenders still mix the drinks strong and the service is decent if a little slow when the place is packed on weekends the downstairs room can get loud and crowded and if you arrive after 9 pm you probably wont be sitting but in its evolution from burnout wino bar to upscale microbrew pub it lost a bunch of character along the way that probably wont be coming back although the meat has made a triumphant return to the menu

i am very fond of this casino as i discovered it is the sole establishment in vegas with an entirely separate nonsmoking area the air quality is noticeably better likely due to filtration additionally the hotel is wellmaintained and affordable and there is an incredible antique store within walking distance that seems to go on forever

i have to take a break from this fast food restaurant for a while because my last two visits have been disappointing my fries were cold both times and i got the wrong chicken in my wrap the receipt was accurate but the line cooks made a mistake today my fries were cold again and im confident that the chicken nuggets were not fresh my food was ready before

i adore zapatas  they provide fantastic live music and scrumptious food my husband who is hispanic even said its comparable to his mothers cooking the wait staff and other employees are incredibly professional and they make sure your drinks are never empty plus they offer complimentary bean dip and chips which my oneyearold daughter absolutely loves along with the music
we often eat at dw bistro but tonights experience was very poor the service

take heed and avoid dishonest business dealings yelp should enable users to award negative stars each negative review of this company is entirely accurate do yourself a favor and steer clear of this company

the downtown grand formerly known as lady luck has undergone a complete renovation and now exudes a swanky hipster and chic atmosphere as with all vegas hotelcasino combos it offers a variety of games from table and card games to slots that are lively and visually engaging the grand also features the art bar the mob bar and several other stylish spots within the casino floor theres a small diner onsite called stewart and ogden as well as the red mansion which is only open on select nights additionally a host of fantastic locallyowned establishments such as pizza rock triple george and hogs and heifers are within walking distance across the street the downtown grands pool picnic is free for guests to access and has a kidfriendly atmosphere with faux grass

i truly wish to enjoy this place but unfortunately after two disappointing visits in one week i wont be returning my friends recommended it for its good vibe and interesting menu but my experiences have been less than satisfactory during my first visit with my family the waiter was great but the food was just average the drink was not good and the burger was overcooked instead of mediumrare the manager came over and offered a free drink and a burger replacement but i told her it was just feedback and i didnt want to make a big deal out of it even though it was burnt

they had high expectations for the mexican corn dish but it was too rich with too much cream cheese making it difficult to enjoy they also found the carnitas to be average and not revolutionized or improved by rick bayless

you know its a cheesecake factory  theyre all the same as far as food service and layout  normally i give the chain a 4 based on food quality and good service but this location is far more challenging to get into than others during busy times  i gave it a three based on that  not their fault i guess but weve wasted a lot of time waiting around for a table or even for togo cheesecake  we probably wont plan on going to this location again unless its during the off hours

stayed four nights here with my girlfriend for a business conference when we arrived the line to check in was not bad we arrived early and we were able to check in early for a fee 28 i believe we were told if we waited 12 hour the fee would only be 15 but they gave us the reduced fee without waiting because of medical reasons they also provided a refrigerator in room free normally 25day for medical reasons which is that i had medication that needed to be refrigerated nnentering the room i noticed one bed was seriously concave but the other one was fine there was a lighted table that the cord had been severed and the wires exposed we informed the bell guy when he brought our bags but we didnt care enough to change rooms the carpet was loose looked like water damage to me the tv was fine but has absolutely no jacks so you cant hook anything up to watch movies or music or games they do charge for internet 1399day per device good news is starbucks and some restaurants have free wifi nnthe bathroom was huge and very nice but the shower was weak the bathtub is awesome and easily fits two but ours didnt drain so called maintenance they didnt fix it the first night gross but the second time we called they snaked it made mess housekeeping came to clean whole process took about three hours i assume the issue was resolved but we didnt use the tub again after that also when people in other rooms shower it is loud as hell but i never heard the people talk or laugh or any other noises lolnnwe called to speak with a manager about the plumbing issues the girl that answered olivia has a thick accent apparently she was saying manager but to us it sounded like she was saying money gift and when we finally figured it out we laughed about the misunderstanding she was rude accused my gf of laughing at her and then hung up on her call back and got the gm brian he was a dick from the start he offered to give us a free late check out which we already had arranged so he took off the early check in fee and a room service charge a total discount of 36 nnwhile speaking with brian we discovered that we had a charge for room service that wasnt ours so we called the room service manager pharrin she was absolutely awesome she immediately looked into the incorrect charge took it off our bill and even offered to cover our breakfast the following morning nnoverall it was ok and mostly our individual room  the front desk people that got the 1 star i would stay there again all the fees are kinda ridiculous but there are ways around those

i didnt choose the hibachi option at the sushi bar as i had enough of benihana and it seemed quite pricey additionally there was no wait time for sushi at the bar please note that i am used to california sushi restaurants and my japanese friends might have higher standards i havent had good sushi since moving to dc i shared the pittsburgh penguins roll while in pittsburgh a spicy squid salad salmon ceviche which cannot be found on the online menu and a philadelphia roll because my friend had never tried it before everything was really good especially the spicy squid salad and salmon ceviche which had thick pieces of salmon but was nicely presented however not everyone shared the same opinion overall it is a good and solid japanese restaurant and i would visit again

in the note it was mentioned that they didnt go for hibachi as they had enough of benihana and found it expensive there was no wait time for sushi at the bar they added a disclaimer that they are accustomed to california sushi restaurants and their japanese friends would have more elevated standards they also mentioned that they havent had good sushi since relocating to dc

i decided against hibachi at the sushi bar because of my experience with benihana and the high price the wait time for sushi at the bar was nonexistent as a disclaimer i am accustomed to california sushi restaurants and my japanese friends would likely have higher expectations i havent found good sushi since moving to dc i shared the pittsburgh penguins roll a spicy squid salad

i have a love for the bjs chain but this specific restaurant is quite inconsistent is experienced some of the worst service ever at this location last winter a group of seven of us had lunch there and it took 30 minutes just to get our drinks and another 20 minutes to place our order so it took us a total of 50 minutes before we could even order our food the pizza at this particular bjs is also terrible they barely put any sauce on the crust and overcook it

i enjoy eating at og because they serve dim sum until 1030 pm the restaurant offers a variety of dim sum dishes which are brought to the tables on carts by ladies there are different carts for steamed fried starchy sweet and bun items when you select a dish from the cart the lady will stamp your card according to the price of the dish which varies depending on the cart be cautious not to overindulge as the prices range from 140 to over 260 per item and it can add up quickly besides the dim sum they also have a regular menu i have been eating dim sum since i was young and i find that all of ogs dishes are good although not exceptional i recommend visiting during peak hours for fresher food the menu includes various types of dumplings fried shrimp chinese broccoli and more try the fried items those with chili sauce and those with their special mayonnaise however be aware that the cashier girl can be quite rude as she rarely greets or smiles at customers i prefer og over cathay house because their servers are more attentive and do not skip tables

macaroni grill wasnt amazing and im not a huge admirer of it but it surpasses olive garden and is an acceptable choice for a fast italian food chain the food was moderately good and fairly priced encouraging me to revisit in the future

this spot is incredibly tasty and i often opt for the spicy miso ramen which never fails to amaze me i adore the fusion of flavors and its a speedy ramen joint i simply enter order and wait around 10 minutes for my food the gyoza is equally delightful and im grateful for a ramen place off the strip and close to my residence

brillobox a bar located at the intersection of penn and main had previous incarnations as nooners and zootys these bars were known for attracting morning drunks providing a place to kill time en route to the methadone clinic and hosting sightings of the notorious lawrenceville sweatpants hookers in 2005 a new york couple purchased the bar and turned it into brillo and it has since become a popular spot for libations among grad students upmc pediatric surgery residents and 1890s moustache fetishists
the music and acting were outstanding and were grateful for the chance to have seen it prior to its departure nonetheless i concur that it appeared to be a tad slow
a tiny eatery offering fast food for latenight revelers and daytime snackers with superior falafels compared to pita pit and friendly staff

we dine at dw bistro regularly but tonight we had a very bad experience the service tonight was exceptionally slow we had to wait 10 minutes before someone took our order and 30 minutes after our salad was served  we waited for an hour for our main entree to show up but it never did we had to follow up twice from our server please note that we did it very nicely on where was our food and he even blamed the kitchen for the slow service and that it wasnt his fault nnin the end my bf was so pissed that the server didnt even have the decency to tell us that the kitchen is running behind we just left and paid for the salad nnwe love the food at dw but if the service is like this too bad we are scratching you off our list

for the time being ill be excluding this fast food location from my regular lunch spots due to two consecutive visits that were disappointing on both occasions the fries were cold and my order was incorrect once the food quality was poor and the service was unacceptable with a single employee handling orders and food preparation resulting in slow service additionally the cashier was rude to customers i miss the old manager who ensured the staff provided good service

this place is amazing as it updates the classic wisconsin bar and grill with fresh delicious food one point that hasnt been mentioned is that the sunday brunch is incredible and its the only time the establishment isnt crowded so please dont go if you dont want it to become overcrowded the egg burgers are indeed great and they offer an excellent selection of wisconsin beers and cheese plates the only drawback is the lack of vegetarian options

i really like this casino  i was informed it is the only one in vegas that has a completely  separate  nonsmoking room i tell you  the air is cleaner in there i think it is filtered nthe hotel is clean and inexpensive plus you can walk to an awesome antique store that lasts forever

i appreciate this casino as ive been informed that its the only one in vegas featuring a completely separate nonsmoking room the air quality is cleaner there which may be attributed to filtration the hotel is wellkept and reasonably priced plus theres an amazing antique store within walking distance that seems to go on forever

the downtown grand is just that grandnnformerly lady luck the property has been completely gutted remodeled and modernized the grand is swanky hipster and chic as all vegas hotelcasino combos do there are tables games card games and multiple slots that sing and dance and light up the grand also hosts the art bar protip look up when drinking them down here and mob bar and several little decked out spots on the casino floor there is a small diner located on the property stewart and ogden and red mansion which is only open on select nights and there are a host of several awesome locally owned establishments across the street pizza rock triple george hogs and heifers and various other awesome places within reasonable walking distance whats really cool about the grand is that there are signs telling you which direction these places are located props the grands pool is called picnic free access when staying which has faux grass is kid friendly and has a variety of specialsnnthe rooms did not disappoint either for 63 a night youre furnished with awesome views of the city a large king bed a large flat screen tv free wifi and because downtown tends to get loud ear buds the rooms have also been updated and have a modern touch until you get to the bathrooms no big tub no fan for when you go booboo and it isnt anything really too special nnall in all the grand is a great value and just one block from the heart of downtown

ill be taking a break from this fast food restaurant for a while as the quality of the food and service has declined during my last two visits the fries were cold and the orders were incorrect the food wasnt fresh and the service was slow and rude i miss the old manager who used to keep the staff performing well

its disappointing that despite the need for package sending and passport applications the waiting time in line is consistently horrible no matter the time of day one could wait anywhere from 10 to 50 minutes just to send a mailer envelope the postal service often has only one or two employees behind the desk who are quite slow in their processing

this little establishment has a small entrance and serves quick meals for the tipsy groups lurking around the mill at night as well as for daytime snacking i enjoy their falafels more than the ones at pita pit and the service was very hospitable ill be coming back

i love this place an updating of the classic wisconsin bar n grill fresh good food one thing ill say that hasnt been said is that the sunday brunch is awesome and its the one time of day the place isnt crowded so please dont go otherwise confirmation that the egg burgers are great wisconsin beer selection a and cheese plates fun only ding is not enough vegetarian options

the sangria was tasty but none of them could get a buzz off of it the mexican corn came out and it was too rich with way too much cream cheese making it hard to enjoy the carnitas was better but rb didnt revolutionize or improve upon it sadly the minus one star was due to the service
i thought chateau was great although i dont normally

for an unforgettable breakfast experience try the truffle egg sandwich mediterranean egg white frittata and the best madetoorder beignets outside of new orleans at eat located in a corner building in downtown las vegas the simple yet intimate setting and groovy culture make it a mustvisit destination in the area

i enjoy this casino and im told its the sole vegas casino with a fully separate nonsmoking area the air quality is noticeably better possibly due to filtration the hotel is tidy and affordable and within walking distance of an incredible seemingly endless antique store
the music and acting were amazing and we were happy to have seen it before it closed i agree that it felt slightly lengthy

my favorite casino in vegas stands out because its the only one that has a completely separate nonsmoking room the air in this room is cleaner likely due to the filtration the hotel is clean budgetfriendly and there is a great antique store nearby that you can walk to and explore for hours on end

i enjoy going to og because they offer dim sum until 1030 pm dim sum is served from carts and there are women pushing around different types of carts including steamed fried starch sweets and buns you receive a card and the prices of the food vary depending on the cart when you select an item the lady stamps your card and at the end they tally up the stamps to determine your food cost be cautious not to grab too many items as they range from 140 to over 260 each and it can quickly add up they also have a regular menu

i adore the bjs chain but this particular restaurant is very inconsistent i have encountered some of the worst service ever at this location last winter a group of seven of us had lunch there and it took 30 minutes just to get our drinks and another 20 minutes to place our order so it took us a total of 50 minutes before we could even order our food the pizza at this particular bjs is also terrible they barely put any sauce on the crust and overcook it

what a great addition to downtown las vegas  while one can always grab lunch or breakfast in any of the casinos along fremont street theres nothing hip upbeat with an amazing menu  great service like eat of downtown las vegas  after being born and raised in larger metropolitan cities my favorite dining places are always the ones that are the hole in the wall locations where they are the true gems best kept secrets and where you normally can only find them via word of mouth nneat is one of those places its located on a corner building simple intimate setting yet with the hip vibe and groovy culture of downtownnnfor breakfast try the truffle egg sandwich mediterranean egg white fritatta and id say the best made to order beignets west of new orleans cafe du monde original  yummmnnthis place has heart in everything from the menu environment  of course the service

ill be avoiding this fast food place for a while as it has been disappointing during my last two visits the fries were cold both times and the order was incorrect once the food wasnt fresh and the service was terrible its a shame because i miss the old manager who kept the staff on their toes

the original question or statement has been rephrased three times the first rephrasing is spent four nights with my girlfriend at the hotel for a business conference the checkin line wasnt too bad when we arrived early and we were able to check in early for a fee of 28 which was supposed to be 15 if we waited 12 hours but they gave us the reduced fee without waiting due to medical reasons they also provided a free refrigerator in the room normally 25 per day for medical reasons  my medication needed to be refrigerated the room had one seriously concave bed but the other one was fine and there was a lighted table with exposed wires informed the bell guy but didnt care enough to change rooms the carpet was loose and looked like water damage the tv was fine but had no jacks for external devices and they charge for internet 1399 per device the good news is that starbucks and some restaurants have free wifi the bathroom was huge and nice but the shower was weak and the bathtub didnt drain called maintenance and they fixed it eventually but we didnt use the tub again when people in other rooms showered it was loud but we never heard them

were regular customers at dw bistro but tonights experience was very poor the service was exceptionally slow taking 10 minutes to take our order and 30 minutes after our salad was served we waited an hour for our main dish which never arrived we approached our server twice who blamed the kitchen for the delay and said it wasnt his fault eventually my boyfriend became so upset that the server didnt bother to tell us the kitchen was behind and we left without our main course paying only for our salad we enjoy the food at dw

i love hot dogs love so why did it take me so long to visit buldogis location its almost a 30 minute drive for me which is far for vegas and the hot dog isnt exactly a meal i plan out way in advance nthat being said the hot dogs are awesome great selection of specialty dogs with american korean and mexican toppings or you can always go plain jane the dog itself is really high quality  all beef with plenty of snap and if that doesnt appeal to you they have a spicy one a veggie one and i think one thats more like sausage we tried the bulgogi and east coast pastrami and sauerkraut dogs and both were great about 6 each and very filling the munchkin likes her corn dog but it wasnt anything special we went for plain fries instead if one with all the toppings which was good because the dogs were way filling nthe ambiance is a little lacking as almost nothing was changed from the old quiznos  they even use the same q open signnoverall i loved it but its a little far to be a random lunch spot for us

i had a great time at chateau even though i dont usually go to big vegas clubs my friend invited me and got me on the guest list so i decided to give it a try the club is lovely but it was quite crowded and the bathroom lines were long the outdoor area with views of the strip was enjoyable but the drinks are a bit expensive a surprise performance by ciara was a highlight for me i recommend checking out this place i also wrote about vegas restaurants hotels shows and how to save money while there for more information visit letsjetsetcom

while traveling through mesa in our rv our pet encountered issues with urination including slight blood and vomiting bile we found central mesa vet through yelp and were impressed by their 5star reviews the reviews were accurate as dr senter and her team were caring thorough and provided a diagnosis of crystals in our pets urinary tract they also gave us tips on prevention and medication we give them 5 stars as well and are grateful for their help

first some facts about brillobox which is conveniently located at the corner of penn and main formerly known as nooners and then zootys it was once a safe haven for morning drunks a pitstop for those heading to the methadone clinic and a popular spot for sightings of the infamous lawrenceville sweatpants hookers however in late 2005 the 224 started blowing up and a new york couple bought the bar converting it into the beloved brillo from that point on it was destined to become the libations palace for grad students upmc pediatric surgery residents and 1890s moustache fetishists along the way brillobox went through an alltoobrief adolescence that was equal parts awkward and beautiful notable patrons from its 20062008 era included american apparel employees en route to their greenpoint lofts 30somethings who preached tolerance and diversity and a group of aspiring writers who were alcoholic smoked and danced like fiends then in the dawn of the 2010s brillo made its final push toward adulthood by making bold gestures

my friends from michigan visited and we wanted to eat at a decent place and then go to a strip club we found treasures50 which offered 50 entrees for free admission to the strip club and a free limo we thought it was a great deal with everything in one place the restaurant and strip club were in the same building but the restaurant took up most of the space the food was okay but it was strange eating while strippers passed by to go to the table behind us maybe it was a bachelor party i dont enjoy eating with naked women around but some guys might like that we checked out the strip club after eating but it wasnt great so we left quickly no regrets though it was a unique experience

during our travels in mesa with our rv our furry friend experienced issues urinating with traces of blood and bile vomiting we found central mesa vet through yelp and were pleased with their 5star ratings the reviews were right on point dr senter and her staff were excellent caring and meticulous they identified crystals in our pets urinary tract offered tips for prevention and prescribed medication we also give them 5 stars for their outstanding care

stayed at the hotel for four nights with my girlfriend for a business conference we arrived early and were able to check in early for a fee of 28 which was reduced to 15 due to medical reasons they provided a free refrigerator for our room because i needed to store medication the room had a concave bed exposed wires and a poor draining bathtub but the bathroom was huge and nice the front desk staff was rude but the room service manager was awesome fixing our bill and offering to cover our breakfast

on my first visit to the lioness i was happy to find glutenfree beer available since i dont frequent leith often it was a pleasant surprise to find a pub that offers gf options although ive had brunch in leith before ive found the menus lacking in glutenfree friendliness so i usually avoid them the lioness is part of a new group of pubs that have opened recently featuring reclaimed furniture wooden decor and even a pinball machine we sat at the pinball machine for novelty value but the stools werent very comfortable we had some average chips which contributed to my threestar rating if im in the area i might return to try more of the gffriendly menu and possibly increase the rating

the spicy miso ramen at this place is incredible and i cant get enough of it the flavors blend together perfectly making it a fast and tasty option for a ramen fix its also great that its located near my home away from the busy strip

i adore this location which offers a modern twist on the traditional wisconsin bar and grill they serve scrumptious fresh food one thing id like to mention that hasnt been said before is that their sunday brunch is fantastic and its the only time the place isnt packed with people so please dont attend if you dont want to overcrowd it additionally i can confirm that the egg burgers are great and they have a terrific selection of wisconsin beers and cheese plates the only downside is that there arent enough vegetarian options

this establishment never fails to impress with its delectable spicy miso ramen the combination of flavors is sublime and the swift service is perfect for a quick and satisfying meal i appreciate that its located conveniently near my residence and away from the bustling strip

if possible its recommended to avoid this particular postal service location due to its long wait times slow service and inconsistent delivery the sender had a negative experience when they first moved to vegas where not all of their packages were delivered directly to their new address causing additional inconvenience during an already stressful period

love zapatas they have live music and amazing food my husband is hispanic and he said it almost matches his moms cooking the wait staff was very professional and the people who come between the waiters are great you never have an empty drink love the complimentary bean dipsalsa and chips my daughter is one and loves the music
the worst  i had a bone in the chicken taco  the guacamole was fake as was the sour cream

after a complete failure with the dental specialty group office they didnt keep their word about the cost of my dental implant dr lillien did a fantastic job with the procedure but then the office wanted to add an extra 750 for an abutment that was supposed to be part of the original price in other words if your dentist drives a maserati youre probably going to be ripped off so they can pay for it

so this is my update after a total debacle with the dental specialty group office not coming through with honoring what they quoted in pricing my dental implant  dr lillien did a great job in his work but then the office turned around and wanted to charge me another 750 for an abutment that was quoted as being included in the original pricennneedless to say if your dentist drives a maserati you are probably going to get screwed over so he can make his payment
beware of the thief and dishonest practices in business yelp must allow users to give negative stars every single bad review about this company is true help yourself by avoiding this company

although macaroni grill wasnt perfect i am not a huge fan either however it does deserve more than just an okay rating compared to olive garden it is definitely better and makes for a great fast italian chain the food was decent and affordably priced i will definitely return

we frequently eat at dw bistro but had a terrible experience this evening the service was abnormally sluggish it took 10 minutes for someone to take our order and an hour after our salad was served we still hadnt received our main course we politely inquired with our server twice about the delay and he blamed the kitchen and claimed it wasnt his fault in the end my boyfriend was so upset that the server didnt have the courtesy to inform us about the kitchens backlog we left without our main course and only paid for our salad we love the food at dw but if the service remains like this well have to remove it from our list
im in love with this location which is an updated version of the traditional wisconsin bar and grill serving up delectable fresh food one thing that hasnt been said yet is that their sunday
a wee holeinthewall offering quick bites for nighttime crowds and daytime hunger featuring falafels superior to pita pits and warm service that invites return visits

i find this casino appealing as its been mentioned to me that its the sole vegas casino boasting a completely separate nonsmoking area the air is purer in this space perhaps due to filtration the hotel is neat and economical and theres a fantastic seemingly neverending antique store just a short walk away
during a business conference my girlfriend and i stayed at this hotel for four nights we arrived early and were able to check in early after paying
i experienced a terrible situation when i found a bone in my chicken taco and both the guacamole and sour cream were not authentic

this tiny eatery provides speedy nourishment for inebriated crowds roaming near the mill after dark and is also perfect for a daytime snack i personally prefer their falafels over those at pita pit and the staff were quite welcoming i will definitely come back

zapatas is a wonderful place with live music delicious food and attentive staff my hispanic husband even thinks their cooking is comparable to his moms not only that but the waiters and other attendants keep our drinks full and they offer free bean dip and chips my oneyearold daughter adores the music too

it wasnt aok but i am not a huge fan either macaroni grill deserves a little more than an aokay its for sure better than olive garden and great for a fast italian chain the food was actually decent and reasonably priced  i will come back again
you know its a cheesecake factory and they all have similar food service and layout normally i would rate the chain a 4 based on food quality and good service but this location is more challenging

im a fan of og because they serve dim sum until late at night there are different carts for dim sum and ladies push them around with various options such as steamed fried starch sweets and buns they give you a card to keep track of your selections and each item on the cart has a different price based on the cart type when you choose a dish the lady puts a stamp on your card and the stamps are counted to determine your food cost its essential to be mindful when selecting items because they cost between 140 and over 260 each and the cost can add up quickly

the downtown grand which used to be called lady luck has been completely remodeled and now has a swanky hipster and chic ambiance the casino features multiple games card games and slots that light up the room the property has the art bar mob bar and several other stylish spots along with a small diner called stewart and ogden and red mansion which is only open on specific nights there are also signs directing you to local establishments like pizza rock triple george and hogs and heifers

why did it take me so long to visit the buldogi location despite my love for hot dogs the 30minute drive is quite far for vegas and a hot dog isnt usually something i plan in advance however their hot dogs are awesome with a great selection of special

the lioness a new pub in leith offers daura damm gf beer which i found pleasing on my first visit despite not frequently visiting leith ive noticed that the menus often lack glutenfree friendliness leading me to avoid the area the lioness with its reclaimed furniture wood and pinball machine has changed that perception while the chips were just okay the availability of gf beer and potential gf menu options might make me return for further exploration
im a big fan of the bjs chain but this specific restaurant is quite inconsistent is experienced some of the worst service ever at this location last winter a group of seven of

the postal services inconsistency and inefficiency can be frustrating especially during stressful times when moving to las vegas the sender had 12 boxes of the same size and weight sent through the postal service but only a few were delivered directly to their apartment complex the rest had to be picked up at the post office which doesnt make sense since the ones that arrived at the complex did so over several days
